DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study assess benefit Percutaneous Neuromodulation Therapy compare reference sham treatment treatment patient undergone surgical intervention chronic low back pain without radiate low extremity pain component .
DOC.brief_title: Percutaneous Neuromodulation Therapy ( PNT ) With Chronic Low Back Pain Patients
DOC.criteria: Low back pain least 6 month If low extremity pain present , must present least 3 month Visual analog scale ( VAS ) score low back pain least 50 100 Lumbar lumbosacral surgical intervention without pain relief Central sensitization symptom Agrees follow randomize treatment plan 18 year age older Signed informed consent form Significant change low back low extremity pain within 4 week prior enrollment Nociceptive and/or neuropathic pain symptom spine due structural and/or mechanical instability Three lumbar lumbosacral surgical intervention ; one surgical intervention area lumbar lumbosacral spine Three lumbar vertebral segment fuse Lumbar lumbosacral surgical intervention last 9 month ; area lumbar lumbosacral last 12 month Any additional surgical intervention require 3 month postenrollment Symptoms consistent sympatheticallymaintained pain Evidence serious neurological deficit impairment Significant change pain medication within 4 week prior enrollment Psychosocial issue conflict valid reporting patient Prior treatment percutaneous electrical stimulation sensitivity electrical stimulation Current use another electrical stimulation device low back low extremity pain Current enrollment another clinical trial within last 30 day Current prior malignancy cancer Serious uncontrolled systemic illness Body mass index ( BMI ) great 40 Pregnant intend become pregnant study Implanted medical device Relationship study staff Unable attend study office visit complete study measure
